base_notes: All hours must be AMA PRA Category 1. No rollover of credits allowed. Professional boundaries course required for new licensees (1 hour within 12 months) and one-time requirement for existing licensees by December 31, 2025.
content_requirements_summary: OPIOID_PRESCRIBING (Controlled substance prescribing practices): 2.00 hrs - PER_YEAR - CONDITIONAL: Applies to all Alabama Controlled Substance Certificate holders | PROFESSIONAL_BOUNDARIES (Board-designated professional boundaries): 1.00 hrs - ONE_TIME

base_notes: May not be exempted from more than 15 hours in 5-year period. Up to 25 hours may be carried forward to next licensing period.
content_requirements_summary: PAIN_MANAGEMENT (Pain management and opioid use and addiction): 2.00 hrs - PER_RENEWAL - CONDITIONAL: For each licensee who holds a DEA number
exemptions_summary: BOARD_CERTIFICATION - FULL EXEMPTION (AMA or AOA recognized boards)

accreditation_required: AOA Category 1-A minimum 24 hrs; AMA Category 1 max 16 hrs
base_notes: 24 hours must be AOA Category 1-A; no more than 16 hours AMA Category 1. No rollover.
content_requirements_summary: OPIOID_PRESCRIBING (Opioid prescribing OR pain management/addiction): 3.00 hrs - PER_RENEWAL

base_notes: Board does not allow rollover credits. All 40 hours must be board-approved CME.
content_requirements_summary: OPIOID_PRESCRIBING (Opioid prescribing OR pain management/addiction): 3.00 hrs - PER_RENEWAL

base_notes: 50 percent must be in subjects pertaining to physician's primary area of practice and designated as Category 1. One-time requirement of 3 hours in prescribing education within first 2 years of licensure.
content_requirements_summary: OPIOID_PRESCRIBING (Prescribing opioids and/or benzodiazepines): 1.00 hrs - PER_YEAR

base_notes: At least 20 hours must be AOA Category 1A or 1B. Does not accept CME equivalents.
content_requirements_summary: PAIN_MANAGEMENT (Pain management and treatment of terminally ill patients): 12.00 hrs - ONE_TIME - CONDITIONAL: Does not apply to pathologists and radiologists
special_population_summary: Geriatric medicine - Over 25 percent of patient population at least 65 years of age: 20.00% of total

base_notes: If initial license <13 months only 25 hours required. Pain management requirement is one-time only. Board certification = 100 hours credit for 4 consecutive years.
content_requirements_summary: PAIN_MANAGEMENT (Pain management and treatment of terminally ill patients): 12.00 hrs - ONE_TIME - CONDITIONAL: Does not apply to pathologists and radiologists
exemptions_summary: BOARD_CERTIFICATION - 100 hrs credit (ABMS recognized specialty boards)
special_population_summary: Geriatric medicine - Over 25 percent of patient population at least 65 years of age: 20.00% of total

accreditation_required: AMA Category 1, AAFP prescribed credit, ACOG, or national board certification programs
base_notes: Effective January 1, 2026. Board authorized to audit up to 5% of physician renewals annually.
content_requirements_summary: OPIOID_PRESCRIBING (Best practices, substance use disorders, treatment referral, PDMP): 2.00 hrs - PER_RENEWAL - CONDITIONAL: Exempted if maintain national board cert requiring equivalent training or attest no opioid prescribing

accreditation_required: ACCME, AOA, AAFP or state medical society recognized by ACCME
base_notes: In first renewal period and once every 6 years: 1 hour each in infectious diseases, cultural competency, risk management, sexual assault/domestic violence, cognitive issues, and behavioral health. Commissioner may grant waiver for up to 10 hours for board service.
All 40 hours must be AMA or AOA Category 1. Starting 2017 renewals: 2 hours biennially in controlled substance prescribing.
10% of total must be in DOH-identified public health priorities. As part of 2018 renewal: 3 hrs HIV/AIDS, 2 hrs LGBTQ cultural competency, 1 hr pharmacology.

accreditation_required: 20 hours AOA Category 1-A; AMA Category 1 or AOA for remainder
base_notes: 5 hours: 1 hr risk management, 1 hr FL laws/rules, 1 hr controlled substances, 2 hrs medical errors. 1 hr HIV/AIDS (first renewal). 2 hrs domestic violence (every 3rd renewal). 20 hrs AOA Category 1-A.
38 hours general CME + 1 hr HIV/AIDS + 2 hrs medical errors + 2 hrs domestic violence (every 3rd renewal). DEA registrants: 2 hrs controlled substances per biennial renewal.

Effective 1/1/2018: DEA registrants prescribing controlled substances must complete 3 hrs Category 1 on responsible opioid prescribing before next renewal. One-time 2-hour sexual misconduct/professional boundaries course required (effective 1/1/2022). Board may waive 1 hr CME for every 4 hrs uncompensated healthcare, up to 8 hrs per biennium.
100 hours every 2 years; 25% must be Category 1.
All 40 hours must be Category 1 or 1A.
Board may accept ABMS, AOA, or RCPSC certification/recertification in lieu of CME during cycle in which certification granted.

During each 3-year cycle: 1 hr sexual harassment prevention, 1 hr implicit bias. Every 6 years: 1 hr opioids, 1 hr cultural competency, 1 hr dementia. Beginning 7/1/2026: 1 hr implicit bias for maternal health providers; simulation training accepted.
Indiana does not have a set number of required CME hours. Beginning July 1, 2019: 2 hours addressing opioid prescribing and abuse.

May include up to 20 hours carried over from previous period. Board accepts resident training, ABMS/AOA board cert/recert as equivalent to 50 hours Category 1. Primary care providers: 2 hrs child/adult abuse every 3 years. Opioid prescribers: 2 hrs CDC guidelines every 5 years. End-of-life providers: training every 5 years.

Flexible renewal periods: 50 hrs/18 months (20 Cat 1) OR 100 hrs/30 months (40 Cat 1) OR 150 hrs/42 months (60 Cat 1). Using 24-month approximation. Category 3 requirement: 1-3 hours (based on cycle) on pain management, opioid prescribing, or PDMP use.
One-time domestic violence course for primary care physicians. Beginning 1/1/2015: 4.5 hrs per 3-year cycle on KASPER, pain management, or addiction disorders for controlled substance prescribers.

base_statute_citation: La. Admin. Code tit. 46, pt. XLV, §§ 435
base_notes: All must be Category 1. Effective 1/1/2018: CDS licensees complete one-time 3-hour course on drug diversion, best prescribing practices, addiction treatment. One-time board orientation course required. As of 6/20/2025: 1 hr/2 years on nutrition and metabolic health for FM, IM, Peds, OB/GYN.

accreditation_required: 40 hrs osteopathic medical education; primary care: all AOA Cat 1; specialists: AOA/ACGME/AMA Cat 1
base_notes: 100 hrs every 2 years; 40 must be osteopathic. Primary care: all AOA Category 1. Specialists: AOA, ACGME, or AMA Category 1. Controlled substance prescribers: 3 hrs on opioid prescription every 2 years.
All Category 1. 3 hours on opioid prescription every 2 years. Category 1 may include 25 credit hours of ABMS specialty board cert/recert within 24 months preceding renewal.

Effective 10/1/2018: when applying for CDS registration, attest to 2 hrs on prescribing/dispensing controlled substances. Effective 10/1/2021: complete implicit bias training first renewal after 4/1/2022. Time-limited board certification within 5 years of renewal = CME equivalent.

accreditation_required: ACCME, AOA, AAFP or state medical society recognized by ACCME or point of care
base_notes: 2 cr end-of-life (one-time); 3 cr opioid/pain mgmt if prescriber; 10 cr risk management (Cat 1 or 2); 3 cr EHR; child abuse/neglect training; domestic/sexual violence training; 1 cr/hr journal reading or point-of-care. Alzheimer's training for adult populations (one-time). Beginning 6/1/2022: 2 cr implicit bias (applies to risk mgmt).

One-time human trafficking training; 1 hr medical ethics. Effective 12/6/2017: min 3 hrs pain/symptom management (1 hr controlled substances prescribing). Effective 6/1/2022: 2 hrs implicit bias (initial), 1 hr annually (renewal).

1 hr medical ethics required. Effective 12/6/2017: min 3 hrs pain/symptom management. Effective 6/1/2022: 2 hrs implicit bias (initial), 1 hr annually (renewal). ABMS specialty board maintenance activity: max 30 Cat 1 hours.
All must be Category 1. Board may accept ABMS, AOA Bureau of Professional Education, or RCPSC cert/recert in lieu of CME during cycle in which certification granted.
All Category 1. DEA certificate holders: 5 hrs related to prescribing medications with emphasis on controlled substances.

accreditation_required: AMA Category 1 or AOA Category 1A or 2A; OR 40 hrs Cat 1/1A with proof of post-testing
base_notes: 50 hrs AMA Cat 1 or AOA Cat 1A/2A; OR 40 hrs Cat 1/1A with post-testing. ABMS specialty board cert/recert during period = CME equivalent.
Montana does not have a set number of required CME credit hours for physician license renewal.

base_statute_citation: Neb. Admin. R. & Regs. Tit. 172, Ch. 88, § 008
base_notes: All Category 1. May carry over up to 25 hrs to next period. In lieu of CME: AMA Physician's Recognition Award or AOA CME Certification within 24 months. Effective 10/1/2018: controlled substance prescribers complete 3 hrs biennially on opioid prescribing (0.5 hr on PDMPs).

AB 56 (2025) increased from 35 hrs/year. 10 hrs Cat 1A; 2 hrs misuse/abuse of controlled substances, opioid prescribing, or addiction. 2 hrs suicide detection every 4 years. 2 hrs ethics/pain mgmt/addiction or SBIRT; 2 hrs cultural competency/DEI if psychiatrist. MDs/PAs providing emergency services: 2 hrs HIV stigma/discrimination one-time.

20 hrs in specialty scope; 2 hrs ethics/pain mgmt/addiction; 18 hrs other medical ed (includes 2 hrs controlled substances if prescriber, 2 hrs cultural competency/DEI if psychiatrist, 2 hrs suicide detection every 4 yrs, 2 hrs SBIRT one-time). Can receive up to 4 hrs double credit for geriatrics, medication management, rare diseases. AB 56 (2025) removed WMD/bioterrorism requirement.

accreditation_required: 40 hrs Category 1; max 60 hrs Category 2; 3 hrs pain management
base_notes: 100 hrs/2 years: 40 Cat I, max 60 Cat II, 3 hrs pain management. ABMS specialty board exam (initial or recert) = equivalent of 100 Cat I hours.

accreditation_required: 40 hrs Category 1; max 60 hrs Category 2; 6 hrs cultural competence
base_notes: 100 hrs: 40 Cat I, 60 Cat II, 6 hrs cultural competence (additional for pre-3/2/2005 licensees). 2 hrs end-of-life care. For 2019+ renewals: 1 hr on opioids (responsible prescribing, alternatives, risks/signs of abuse/addiction/diversion). New licensees: attend orientation (no CME credit).

All Category 1. New licensees with DEA registration: 5 hrs pain management in first year. Board accepts AMA PRA Category 1, ABMS certificate, or ABMS specialty board cert/recert during renewal period as fulfillment.

base_statute_citation: N.Y. Comp. Codes, R. & Regs. tit. 8, §§ 59.12, 59.13
base_notes: New York does not have set CME hours for renewal. Required: 2 hrs child abuse/maltreatment identification/reporting; infection control/barrier precautions every 4 years. DEA registrants (including residents): 3 hrs pain management, palliative care, and addiction.

accreditation_required: Category 1 relevant to specialty or practice area
base_notes: All Category 1 relevant to specialty/practice. Controlled substance prescribers: 3 hrs from required 60 on controlled substance prescribing practices, recognizing abuse/misuse, chronic pain management. Physicians engaged in ABMS, AOA, or RCPSC recert/MOC program = entire CME requirement satisfied.
All Category 1. Physicians with current ABMS, AOA, or RCPSC certification/MOC/recertification at time of CME audit are exempt.
All 50 hours must be Category 1.
All Category 1. 1 hr on licensee's duty to report. Pain management clinic owner/operators: 20 hrs in pain medicine every 2 years (including ≥1 course on addiction potential).

16 hrs annually; all AOA Cat 1A or 1B. 1 hr annually on prescribing/dispensing/administering controlled substances. DOs without State Bureau of Narcotics and DEA authority for CDS are exempt from controlled substance CME.

All Category 1. 1 hr pain management or opioid use/addiction each year preceding renewal (unless no DEA registration). Every 2 years: 1 hr training on responsibilities/rights of healthcare providers. Board accepts AMA PRA, ABMS specialty board cert/recert during 3-year period as verification.

60 hrs/2 years (or 30 if licensed in second year of biennium). All AMA Cat 1; AOA Cat 1A or 2A. All licensees (except Lapsed, Limited, Telemedicine, Teleradiology, Telemonitoring): 1-hr pain management course + min 6 hrs pain mgmt and/or terminally ill treatment. Cultural competency, suicide risk assessment, Alzheimer's education count toward mandatory CME. Demonstrate competency via CME OR ABMS/AOA-BOS recert/MOC participation.

accreditation_required: 20 hrs Category 1-A; 12 hrs patient safety/risk mgmt; 2 hrs child abuse; remainder Cat 1 or 2
base_notes: 100 hrs: 20 Cat 1-A, 12 patient safety/risk mgmt (Cat 1 or 2), 2 child abuse recognition/reporting, remainder Cat 1 or 2. Within 12 months of initial licensure: 2 hrs pain mgmt or addiction identification + 2 hrs opioid prescribing. Subsequent renewals: 2 hrs pain mgmt, addiction identification, or prescribing.

accreditation_required: 20 hrs Category 1; 12 hrs patient safety/risk mgmt; 2 hrs child abuse; remainder Cat 1 or 2
base_notes: 100 hrs: 20 Cat 1, 12 patient safety/risk mgmt, 2 child abuse recognition/reporting, remainder Cat 1 or 2. Within 12 months of initial licensure: 2 hrs pain mgmt or addiction identification + 2 hrs opioid prescribing. Subsequent renewals: 2 hrs pain mgmt, addiction identification, or prescribing. Acceptable Cat 1: AMA PRA, ACCME-accredited, medical professional society, ABMS specialty certification.

base_statute_citation: Reglamento General de la Junta de Licenciamiento y Disciplina Medica de Puerto Rico 9.1
base_notes: 60 hrs/3 years: 50% in specialty area. Required: 2 hrs Dengue/Chikungunya/Zika, 1 hr diabetes, 1 hr vaccination, 1 hr obesity prevention, 1 hr cardiovascular health, 3 hrs pain mgmt, 3 hrs antibiotics, 4 hrs bioethics/professionalism. Autism providers: 15 hrs autism. Pediatricians: 6 hrs autism. ER physicians: 20 hrs Emergency Medicine (including CPR, ACLS, PALS, emergency mgmt).

All AMA Cat 1 or AOA Cat 1A. 2 hrs on universal precautions, infection control, transmission modes, bioterrorism, end-of-life, palliative care, OSHA, ethics, or pain mgmt. ABMS MOC participation = CME equivalent.

All Category 1; ≥30 hrs directly related to practice area; ≥2 hrs on approved procedures for prescribing/monitoring Schedules II-IV controlled substances. May instead demonstrate ABMS, AOA, or other approved specialty board certification/recertification.
South Dakota does not have a set number of required CME credit hours for physician license renewal.
All AOA 1A or 2A. ≥2 of 40 hrs designated to address prescribing practices.

All Category 1. ≥2 of 40 hrs on controlled substance prescribing (must include Dept treatment guidelines on opioids, benzodiazepines, barbiturates, carisoprodol; may include addiction, risk mgmt tools). Intractable pain treatment providers: specialized CME in pain management.

accreditation_required: 24 hrs AMA Cat 1 or AOA Cat 1A; 24 hrs informal self-study/hospital lectures/grand rounds/case conferences
base_notes: 48 hrs: 24 AMA Cat 1 or AOA Cat 1A (2 on ethics/professional responsibility including risk mgmt, domestic/child abuse; human trafficking must be included), 24 informal self-study/lectures/rounds. Direct patient care: 2 hrs opioid/controlled substance pain mgmt in each of first two renewals post-licensure, then every 8 years. Pain clinic practitioners: 10 hrs annually in pain mgmt. Exempt if ABMS board cert/recert in preceding 36 months. Effective 9/1/2025: nutrition training per Texas Nutrition Advisory Committee guidelines.
≥40 hrs each year; Board may accept average of 40 hrs but no less than 25 hrs/year over 3-year period.

accreditation_required: 34 hrs Category 1; 6 hrs max from DOPL; up to 15% from volunteer healthcare (1 cr/4 hrs) and AOA/ACCME residency participation
base_notes: 40 hrs: 34 Cat 1, max 6 hrs from DOPL. Up to 15% from volunteer services (1 CME/4 hrs documented) and AOA/ACCME residency participation. Controlled substance prescribers: ≥3.5 hrs in controlled substance prescribing classes. ≥1 online suicide prevention training course from DOPL list.
30 hrs/2 years meeting Board requirements.
30 hrs/2 years. 1 hr hospice, palliative care, or pain mgmt services. DEA registrants: ≥2 hrs on safe/effective prescribing of controlled substances and pain management.
60 hrs: 30 Cat 1, remainder Cat 2. Up to 15 Cat 2 hrs may be satisfied through voluntary services to low-income individuals via local health dept or free clinic.

150 hrs/3 years; 60 Cat 1. One-time 6-hr suicide assessment/treatment/mgmt. Effective 1/1/19: opioid prescribers complete one-time ≥1 hr on best practices in opioid prescribing or current opioid prescribing rules. Min 2 hrs health equity per cycle. Board may accept ABOMS or ABMS cert/recert within last 6 years, among other CME equivalents.

accreditation_required: May earn all 200 in Cat 1, but max 80 hrs each of Cat 2, 3, 4, 5
base_notes: 200 hrs/4 years. May earn all 200 in Cat 1, or max 80 each of Cat 2/3/4/5. One-time 6-hr suicide assessment/treatment/mgmt. Min 2 hrs health equity per cycle. Effective 1/1/19: opioid prescribers complete one-time ≥1 hr on best practices in opioid prescribing or opioid prescribing rules. In lieu of CME: AMA PRA in ≥2 of 4 years preceding renewal; ABMS cert in 4 years preceding; or ABMS MOC participation at renewal.

32 hrs: 16 AOA Cat 1A or 1B. Beginning 5/1/2014: min 3 hrs drug diversion training and best practice prescribing of controlled substances via Board-approved program. Licensee in clinical residency >9 months of most recent period may substitute verification of participation for CME documentation.

All Category 1. 30 hrs in specialty area(s). May count up to 20 hrs medical student teaching/preceptorship in 50-hr total. 3-hr Board-approved Risk Assessment and Responsible Prescribing of Controlled Substances can be used for 3 of 50 hrs. May satisfy all except 3-hr Risk Assessment by: ABMS cert/recert during reporting period; successful MOC through ABMS during reporting period; or completing 1 full year ACGME postgraduate training during reporting period.

All Category 1. 2 hrs on prescribing opioids and other controlled substances. Must be AMA or AOA Cat 1, but no longer require specific MEB approval. This 30-hr requirement is separate from 8-hr DEA requirement, but DEA courses can fulfill CME requirement.

60 hrs/3 years; all Cat 1 or 2. Controlled substance registration holders: 1 hr responsible prescribing of controlled substances or treatment of substance abuse disorders every 2 years. May earn CME via: AMA-approved Cat I or II; AOA-approved; current AMA PRA; or current ABMS specialty board certificate considered equivalent to hours claimed by licensee.
